sentence.Network_en: Senior officers could be considering a coup to restore authoritarian rule.
sentence.Network_cn: 高官们可能会策划一场政变来复辟独裁统治。

sentence.Network_en: Williams felt himself to be senior to all of them.
sentence.Network_cn: 威廉斯认为自己比其他所有人资格都要老。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin, literally older, older man', comparative of senex, sen- 'old man, old'

entry.tran: (在组织或专业领域中)级别高的，资深的
entry.def: The senior people in an organization or profession have the highest and most important jobs.

example.tran: 以色列政府的高级官员

entry.tran: 职位高于…的;资格比…老的;更资深的
entry.def: If someone is senior to you in an organization or profession, they have a higher and more important job than you or they are considered to be superior to you because they have worked there for longer and have more experience.

example.ex: The position had to be filled by an officer senior to Haig...
example.tran: 这个位置必须由一个职位高于黑格的官员来担任。

example.ex: Williams felt himself to be senior to all of them.
example.tran: 威廉斯自认为比他们所有人资格都要老。

entry.tran: 较年长的人;比…大…岁的人
entry.def: Senior is used when indicating how much older one person is than another. For example, if someone is ten years your senior, they are ten years older than you.

example.ex: She became involved with a married man many years her senior.
example.tran: 她和一个比自己大很多岁的已婚男子好上了。

entry.tran: (中学或大学里的)高年级学生，毕业班学生
entry.def: Seniors are students in a high school, university, or college who are the oldest and who have reached an advanced level in their studies.
If you take part in a sport at senior level, you take part in competitions with adults and people who have reached a high degree of achievement in that sport.

example.ex: This will be his fifth international championship and his third at senior level.
example.tran: 这将是他第五个世界冠军，第三个成人级别赛事的冠军。

entry.tran: (高尔夫、网球等体育运动中的)年长的运动员，资深运动员
entry.def: In sports such as golf and tennis, a senior is a professional player who is fairly old and who plays in special competitions against other older players.

means.word_mean: 1. an undergraduate student during the year preceding graduation
2. a person who is older than you are
1. older; higher in rank; longer in length of tenure or service;
2. used of the fourth and final year in United States high school or college;
3. advanced in years; (`aged' is pronounced as two syllables);

sentences.sentence: "elderly residents could remember the construction of the first skyscraper"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 表形容词或表名词,"较……的;较……"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的
stems_affixes.word_buile: infer下面+ior较……的;较……→adj.下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的 n.下级,晚辈
inter在……内+ior较……的;较……→adj.内部的,里面的 n.内部,内地
sen老+ior较……的;较……→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
super在……上面+ior较……的;较……→adj.优良的,卓越的;上级的 n.上级;长者;高手

stems_affixes.value_cn: 较晚的,较远的,不可告人的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ulter远+ior较……的;较……→adj.较晚的,较远的,不可告人的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 年少的/者,三年级的/学生,下级[的]
stems_affixes.word_buile: jun年轻+ior较……的;较……→adj.&n.年少的/者,三年级的/学生,下级[的]
infer下面+ior较……的;较……→adj.下等的,下级的;劣等的,差的 n.下级,晚辈
inter在……内+ior较……的;较……→adj.内部的,里面的 n.内部,内地
sen老+ior较……的;较……→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
super在……上面+ior较……的;较……→adj.优良的,卓越的;上级的 n.上级;长者;高手
essence[n.基本,本质]+ial有……的→essential根本的,本质的
pre前+sen存在,实质+ent表形容词→present存在于前面,放到前面→赠送;上演;出席的;在场的
sen老+ile……的→adj.年老的
sen老+ior较……[的]→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 到场, 存在
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre前+sen存在,实质+ence表名词→presence出席, 到场, 存在
pre前+sen存在,实质+ent表形容词→present存在于前面,放到前面→赠送;上演;出席的;在场的
sen老+ate表名词→n.参议院, 上院
senate[n.参议院, 上院]+or人→参议员
sen老+escence开始……的→开始越来越老
sen老+ior较……[的]→adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生
senior[adj.年长的;地位较高的 n.[大学]四年级学生]+ity表名词→n.资历
senior的缩写→n.先生, 阁下
pre前+sen存在,实质+ent表形容词→present存在于前面,放到前面→赠送;上演;出席的;在场的

Sentence.sentence: But by senior year, two-thirds have moved up to physics," says Gilbert "Our kids are coming to school in part because they know there are adults here who know them and care for them.
Matthew Hill, senior manager at the two-year-old SoHo restaurant Yorkshire Pudding, also uses better ingredients as a means of improving dishes.
Later he spoke with one of the senior managers.

Back in the good old days—say, two years ago, when the last of my children suffered the ordeal (折磨)—a high-school student applying to college could procrastinate all the way to New Year's Day of their senior year, assuming they could withstand the parental pestering (烦扰).
Her son Doug is one of several hundred thousand high-school seniors who had a painful fall.
Today nearly 70 percent of graduating seniors go off to college, including two-year and four-year institutions

sentences.en: Smith is senior to me by three years.
He is a senior member of the committee.
He's my senior by three years.
He was my senior at school.
The seniors are planning to have a gathering.
sentences.cn: 这些毕业班学生计划聚会一次。

jushi.english: He is a senior member of the committee.
